entry.title: Margrethe Parm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1946, Margrethe Parm (pictured) was appointed the director of a women's prison that had been used as a political prison during the German occupation of Norway?

entry.title: Garsa Fwip (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Garsa Fwip's portrayer, Jennifer Beals, did not know what series she was part of when she arrived on set?

entry.title: Portunus segnis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Portunus segnis was one of the earliest Lessepsian migrants to the Mediterranean, being first recorded in 1898 at Port Said?

entry.title: R. B. Schlather (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that R. B. Schlather directed the world premiere of Hertzberg's chamber opera The Rose Elf in Brooklyn, as well as Cimarosa's L'Italiana in Londra and Puccini's Madama Butterfly at the Oper Frankfurt?

entry.title: a station in West Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Lew Dickey Sr. broke into the radio business by buying a station in West Virginia, his son would go on to own Cumulus Media?

entry.title: Dmitry Kolker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Russian scientist Dmitry Kolker was arrested on charges of espionage while being treated for terminal cancer at a hospital and flown to Moscow, dying two days later?

entry.title: Space Forge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Space Forge satellite is scheduled to fly on the first-ever satellite launch from the United Kingdom?

entry.title: Ari Nagel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that mathematics professor Ari Nagel has fathered more than a hundred children?
